cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the southern North Carolina coast, then expected to drift slowly west-southwest across eastern and central South Carolina before curving inland toward the southern Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic interior.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina/South Carolina border (around Wilmington, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck, NC to Cape Charles Light, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds; Tropical-Storm Warning areas noted above.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of North Carolina and South Carolina, with tropical-storm conditions possible northward into southern Chesapeake Bay and portions of the Mid-Atlantic.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts 20–30 mph possible late weekend into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge 1–2 ft possible in upper Chesapeake Bay including Baltimore Harbor during periods of onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, which could cause urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High waves and dangerous rip currents on Chesapeake Bay; potential river‐flood rises on the Susquehanna and Patapsco due to upstream rainfall.
